channel.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]
channel.description:
Not sure what I did, I was working on a couple things a month ago or so and then stopped and now just got back to it and noticed this.
[img]http://i40.tinypic.com/z0fpk.png[/img]
The text is out of place, if I hover over anything lets say a banker, on the top left you won't really see the B it will be like 'anker' with the B barely showing.
Can anyone tell me which method has to do with this?

item.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

Find the method that draws the text and change where it’s drawn…

For example, when you select a spell to cast that text changes to “Cast spell on” or whatever, so find out where that is done and alter it. I can’t be bothered to do the work for you but I had to alter it on RSCE’s client.

Read full topic

item.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:7, topic:424325"][quote author=The Djinn link=topic=526977.msg3841154#msg3841154 date=1323236382]
It doesn’t have to do with the Width\Height though. If I make the client bigger it will still appear the same. It’s where it’s positioned at and I can’t seem to find it for some reason. I just need to lower the positioning & down to the right a little, but I can’t find out where. I’ll still keep looking though.
[/quote]
You don’t seem to understand the problem. Re-read my post.
GameWidth, GameHeight
WindowWidth, GameHeight

Check all of those and change them to what they were default.[/quote]
It’s nothing to do with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

	public int windowWidth = 512;
	public int windowHeight = 334;
	int defaultWidth = 512;
	int defaultHeight = 334;

That’s in the mudclient & I compared it with MoparClassic’s Client.
Also for the GameWidth & GameHeight
There is no default value,

if (lastLoadedNull) {
			Graphics g = getGraphics();
			g.setColor(Color.black);
			g.fillRect(0, 0, gameWidth, gameHeight);
			g.setFont(new Font("Helvetica", 1, 16));
			g.setColor(Color.yellow);
			int i = 35;
if (memoryError) {
			Graphics g2 = getGraphics();
			g2.setColor(Color.black);
			g2.fillRect(0, 0, gameWidth, gameHeight);
			g2.setFont(new Font("Helvetica", 1, 20));
			g2.setColor(Color.white);
			g2.drawString("Error - out of memory!", 50, 50);
			g2.drawString("Close ALL unnecessary programs", 50, 100);
			g2.drawString("and windows before loading the game", 50, 150);
			g2.drawString(

I still believe it has to do with something else. If I don’t figure it out in a bit I’ll just get a new client and transfer everything over.
I’m using the RscAngel Client & remember, it’s resizable.

Read full topic

item.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]

item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

The Djinn:

It doesn’t have to do with the Width\Height though. If I make the client bigger it will still appear the same. It’s where it’s positioned at and I can’t seem to find it for some reason. I just need to lower the positioning & down to the right a little, but I can’t find out where. I’ll still keep looking though.

You don’t seem to understand the problem. Re-read my post.
GameWidth, GameHeight
WindowWidth, GameHeight

Check all of those and change them to what they were default.

Read full topic

item.title: Text out of place[Fixed it]
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“The Djinn, post:3, topic:424325”][quote author=lol k link=topic=526977.msg3840220#msg3840220 date=1323173041]

Not sure what I did, I was working on a couple things a month ago or so and then stopped and now just got back to it and noticed this.

The text is out of place, if I hover over anything lets say a banker, on the top right you won’t really see the B it will be like ‘anker’
with the B barely showing.

Can anyone tell me which method has to do with this?

Try adjusting the client side in width just a bit though… I think that may help if not no clue atm
[/quote]

That doesn’t solve it, it’s the positioning of it. If I made the client bigger it would still position it self in the same place. I’m just not sure what to change to bring it back to normal, and I’ve done quite a few things to the client which I don’t want to redo again if I re downloaded it.

This was added in, but I’m doubting this is the cause of it.

vfz8g3.png1017×364
[/quote]
That can’t cause it, It’s the window width that’s wrong, there’s the game width, height and there’s the window height and width, look from some other client to see what are the default sizes and change them to that. I’ve had the same problem few times.

Read full topic

Try adjusting the client side in width just a bit though… I think that may help if not no clue atm[/quote]

That doesn’t solve it, it’s the positioning of it. If I made the client bigger it would still position it self in the same place. I’m just not sure what to change to bring it back to normal, and I’ve done quite a few things to the client which I don’t want to redo again if I re downloaded it.

This was added in, but I’m doubting this is the cause of it.

vfz8g3.png1017×364
